channel.title: Aubrey Marcus Podcast
channel.description: Founder of Onnit, and modern philosopher Aubrey Marcus asks the important questions:  How do we find our purpose, wake up to who we truly are, have a few more laughs, and human being a little better? The Aubrey Marcus Podcast brings in world class guests from the fields of athletics, health, business, fitness, science, relationship and spirituality, and asks them to open up about the failures and successes that define their wisdom and character.  Follow me on social @AubreyMarcus to keep up with the latest, and meet many of the incredible guests we’ve been honored to have on the show.

item.title: #145 Moving the Body and Mind with Aaron Alexander
item.description:
This podcast is as flexible and funny as the master of movement himself!  Aaron Alexander, host of the Align podcast and gifted body worker, has changed my life since we first met and started working together. We sat down to discuss the wonders of physical existence, but the conversation took some surprising twists and turns. Tune in and let the sounds wiggle through your earholes!

Aaron Alexander on Instagram Twitter Facebook and Youtube

Check out Aligntherapy.com

Connect with Aubrey on Instagram Twitter Facebook or AubreyMarcus.com

Check out Go For Your Win

Get 10% off at Onnit by going to Onnit.com/Aubrey

item.title: #144 True Success Is Healing Yourself
item.description:
FitBody Bootcamp founder Bedros Keuilian has learned a lot about creating a business model that has become the success story for him and hundreds of franchise owners as well, but business is not all he opens up about on this episode. We exchange very candid stories about the experiences and trauma that shaped us into the men we are today, and discuss stress management, letting go of shame, the importance of stillness, and breaking the rules on what being a man is supposed to look like.

Bedros Keuilian on Instagram Twitter Facebook

Check out Empire Podcast Show

Connect with Aubrey on Instagram Twitter Facebook or AubreyMarcus.com

  Get 10% off at Onnit by going to Onnit.com/Aubrey

item.title: #143 The Road Map To Transformation with Anahata Ananda
item.description:
Shamanic healer and feminine energy powerhouse Anahata Ananda returns to the show from Sedona to take us on the journey of taking a concept from formless inspiration to physical manifestation.  She introduces a compass--a complete system, with clear, actionable signposts along the way. This is one of my favorite and most practical chats with her yet to date.

item.title: #142 Aligning Passion and Purpose with Mark Verstegen
item.description:
EXOS founder Mark Verstegen, director of performance for the NFLPA, has made an impressive career of optimizing the lives of pro athletes and people of all walks of life. A heart first entrepreneur, he created the powerhouse human performance company which has recently named Onnit as its official performance nutrition partner. With aligned visions (and names!) Mark and I talk about how we brought passion and purpose together in our own lives to help other people do the same.


Exos on Facebook Instagram Twitter

Connect with Aubrey on Instagram Twitter Facebook or AubreyMarcus.com

Check out Aubrey's new book Own The Day

  Get 10% off at Onnit by going to Onnit.com/Aubrey

item.title: #141 Be Your Own Kind of Hero with Tim Kennedy
item.description:
Former top ranked UFC middleweight, Decorated US Army Green Beret, TV star, and modern day superhero Tim Kennedy knows a thing or two about going for his win, one small choice at a time.  In one of my favorite episodes of all time, we talk about the difference in how he and I ‘go to war’, what propels us forward in the face of fear, and what it truly means to be a man. This episode is a battlecry for the hero that lives inside of us all.  


Tim Kennedy on Instagram Twitter Facebook

Connect on Instagram  Twitter  Facebook or AubreyMarcus.com

Check out Own The Day  and the Aubrey Marcus Collection

   Get 10% off at Onnit by going to Onnit.com/Aubrey

item.title: #140 Your Personal Superpower with John Brenkus
item.description:
Producer, director, and ESPN Sports Science host John Brenkus has made a life out of achieving anything he sets his mind to. But he has not always been this way. John shares stories of personal growth and using obstacles to his advantage that got him from the brink of death to the bleeding edge of his potential.

item.title: #139 Redefining Success with Ryan Holiday
item.description:
Best-selling author, modern stoic, and universal ally of pen, Ryan Holiday returns to the AMP to discuss my new book, Own the Day, and the creative mentality that has helped him establish his own definition of success. We also touch on minimalism, staying humble, and, of course, a dash of stoicism for good measure.

item.title: #138 The Cure is Near with Rick Doblin
item.description:
Founder of MAPS and pioneer of psychedelic therapy Rick Doblin is one of the most unsung heroes of our time. MAPS’ work with the FDA for the approval of treatments for PTSD through physician-assisted psychedelic medicine therapy is on the brink of breakthrough success, and poised to offer lasting healing solutions that liberate people from what would otherwise be a lifetime of suffering.  Rick pulls up a chair at the podcast table to describe how these treatments work, the bright future that our generation will get to witness, and what it has taken to overcome societal stigma and resistance along the way to deliver a cure that just might serve to heal the world.

MAPS on Twitter Facebook Instagram and Youtube

Find out more about The Cure Is Near

Connect on Instagram  Twitter  Facebook or AubreyMarcus.com

    Get 10% off at Onnit by going to Onnit.com/Aubrey

item.title: #137 The Truth Of Who You Are, Spoken Through Paul Selig
item.description:
This is one of the most interesting and significant podcasts I have ever been a part of.  Whether or not you believe that channeler Paul Selig is in touch with guidance from a higher source, the truth of his words and their effect on those around him are undeniable.  We set out to explain who we are, the nature of divine love, and answer questions I never dreamed I would have the opportunity to ask.  

Paul Selig on Facebook Twitter and Instagram

item.title: #136 The Hustle of Success in Music and Life with Jesse Kirshbaum
item.description:
With relentless drive and boundless energy, my real life blood cousin Jesse Kirschbaum hustled his way from being a hungry Brooklyn kid to managing some major hip hop talent as the CEO of NUE Agency, Hot97’s Hot in Tech show host, and editor of Beats & Bytes. We discuss the music business and what it takes to evolve and remain relevant in any industry while staying authentic.

Jesse Kirschbaum on Instagram and Twitter

Check out Nue Agency

item.title: #135 Consciousness Meets Criminal Justice with Michael Wood Jr.
item.description:
Baltimore PD whistleblower and author of “Crimes and Punishment: In the 21st Century”, Michael Wood Jr. joins the show to share lessons from his experiences as an officer and examine America’s law enforcement system layer by layer. We explore the extent of free will, the mechanisms that drive violence, the grander scope of oppression, and the vision for a very different future.

Michael Wood Jr on Instagram and Facebook

item.title: #125 Family Vs. Tribe & Exploring Taboo with AJ Jacobs
item.description: Author AJ Jacobs has a new book coming out that will reveal to you just how many people on this planet you are related to. (Spoiler alert: If you hate a man, anywhere on the globe, he’s probably your distant cousin-- and if you’ve slept with anyone, ever, she probably is too!) His “relatively” gonzo journalistic approach makes for some great stories and authentic opinions including the tales of a full year lived in strict accordance to biblical law.

item.title: #124 The Process of Success and Overcoming Disaster with Lance Armstrong
item.description: From defeating cancer and being a celebrated hero, to his hard and financially perilous fall from grace, professional cyclist and seven time Tour de France winner Lance Armstrong lays it all out in an intimate discussion of what it feels like to lose everything but gain his happiness.

item.title: #123 Psilocybin Can Revolutionize Medicine with Dr. Dave Nichols
item.description: President of Heffter Research Institute, Dr. Dave Nichols, dissects the war on drugs, offers a behind the scenes look at clinical study design, and gives scope to the vast healing potential of psychedelic therapy in numerous medical indications that have had little success with Western medicine.

item.title: #122 To Be A Man with Lewis Howes
item.description: Host of the celebrated School of Greatness podcast and New York Times Bestselling author Lewis Howes, discusses what it means to be a fully embodied man. We cover topics from the management of emotional triggers to handling the haters, and he premieres tools from his upcoming book Mask of Masculinity on how to discard the masks of ego and live fuller and more authentically through vulnerable strength.

item.title: SPECIAL: Maestro Hamilton Souther - Podcast + Live Recording From Ceremony
item.description: In this special edition of the AMP with Hamilton Souther we blend in a live recording from the closing ceremony of my Rose medicine dieta with a powerful podcast on the nature of consciousness. A dieta is a shamanic technology that originated from the South American curandero tradition that amounts to an invitation for a specific plant to offer teachings to an individual. I chose the flower rose. For more on the teachings I received from rose, listen to my latest AMP with Dr. Dan Engle http://aubreymarcus.com/podcast/amp/amp-%E2%80%A2-reconciling-your-demons-with-dr-dan-engle/.

item.title: #52 Dr. Dan Engle - Today Is A Good Day To Die
item.description: In this podcast with twitter.com/drdanengle we talk about the challenges with the pharmaceutical-driven medical system, and the potential for psychedelic medicine to play a keystone role in the paradigm shift. Lastly we ask the question, what does it mean to live the way of the Lakota warrior? With Hoka Hey "Today Is A Good Day to Die" on your breath?

item.title: #49 Ted Dekker - Exploring Consciousness
item.description: Bestselling author Ted Dekker is one of my greatest spiritual teachers. His journey started in a tribe of active cannibals as the son of a missionary, and eventually brought him to a profound reinterpretation of the true teachings of Yeshua. It is an honor to have him join me on the podcast and share his unique perspective.

item.title: #47 Hamilton Souther Part One
item.description: Every once in a while an individual comes along and changes the game. Whether it is a sport, profession, cause--things are irrevocably altered after they make their appearance. Hamilton Souther, an ayahuasca shaman in his prime, is doing just that for the realm of the spirit. In part 1 we get to know each other a bit, letting the cosmic dance unfold as we explore the most important topics for humanity.

item.title: #46 Mikal Vega: A Navy Seal Takes On Post Traumatic Stress
item.description: Military veterans are committing suicide at a rate of over 22 soldiers every day. Mikal Vega is a retired Navy Seal veteran who treated his own post traumatic stress with a combination of yoga, breath work, floatation, and TBI recovery modalities. He now works with veterans across the nation with his organization VitalWarrior.org. We all have stress and trauma in our lives, and this podcast provides actionable advice on how to move past that and reach our creative potential.

item.title: #45 Steven Kotler - The Most Addictive Performance Drug in The World: Flow
item.description: Steven Kotler, bestselling author of The Rise of Superman, stops by to teach us how to get our fix of the most addictive drug in the world: Flow state. Being in the zone is estimated to improve performance by upwards of 500%. This podcast is full of hacks that include many of the triggers necessary to stimulate this much coveted brain state, and explains the risks and benefits of riding the cycle of flow.

The discussion ranged from reincarnation, to the remedy for suffering, and finally the coming awakening. This is a Warrior Poet Project not to be missed.

item.title: #25 Daniele Bolelli
item.description: Honor. It is a word steeped in historical tradition and the warrior ethos. But what does it mean today? Who better to explore the subject than my brother from an Italian mother, Daniele Bolelli.

item.title: #24 Robert Greene
item.description: I set a goal to have a conversation with Robert Greene (Author of 48 Laws of Power, and Mastery) many years before podcasting was a word in my vocabulary. Today it has come to fruition as I explore the ideas behind the works one of the most influential authors of our time.

item.title: #23 Dr. Chris Ryan
item.description: In this podcast with author Dr. Chris Ryan of the game-changing Sex At Dawn, we attack the practicality of what comes next. How do we get from here to there in a world that doesn't easily permit returning to the old ways? While there is no single road that will work as a panacea, the basic principles all lead to greater happiness for singles and couples alike.

item.title: #22 Kevin Johnson of Zero Gravity Institute
item.description: In this first podcast back from a long hiatus, I talk with float master Kevin Johnson, owner and creator of the Zero Gravity Institute in Austin, which very well might be the best sensory deprivation experience in existence. We discuss everything from the logistics, to the practical and ultimately spiritual potential of this most unique medicine.

item.title: #21 Live Q&A With Cory Allen
item.description: In this experimental Q&A podcast with Cory Allen, we get to some of the core questions from our listeners, which happen to be some of the core questions in life. More than ever, I personally benefitted from the viewpoints of my cohost. Particularly if you are interested in practical meditation technique, this is an ideal podcast to listen to.

item.title: #20 MAPS Org Rick Doblin
item.description: In this special 2 hour podcast I meet with MAPS http://www.maps.org founder and psychedelic science pioneer Rick Doblin along with one of the chief researchers Dr. Charles Grob. Our discussion ranges from their own personal history and how they came to be leaders in the field, to the wider applications and futures of psychedelic medicine.

item.title: #18 Stephen "Twitch" Boss
item.description: In this podcast with dance legend Stephen 'tWitch' Boss from "So You Think You Can Dance" fame we freestyle about the conformist pressures in society, and how the real warrior poet shrugs it off like dirt on your shoulder. We also get into the primal instinct inside human beings to dance, and what that means for us as a people.

And lastly we talk about life, the good parts and the better parts because its a beautiful fucking day to be alive!

item.title: #15 Poker Podcast with Matt and Jared Vengrin
item.description: In this podcast I welcome the brothers Vengrin, two professional poker players who help us puzzle out how to translate mastery of poker into mastery of life. A must listen for anyone interested in the ingredients and mindset of a professional poker player. Enjoy!

item.title: #13 Kane Waselenchuk
item.description: In this lucky 13th edition of the Warrior Poet Project I'm with the most dominant athlete in his sport, Kane Waselenchuk. We go into the mind of what created this 7 time world champion who hasn't lost a single match in 4 years, and extrapolate lessons from the racquetball court to every day life.

item.title: #12 Donald Schultz
item.description: Strapping a bloody fish to your leg in shark infested waters. Sleeping in a box with deadly snakes. Base Jumping. Gunfights with rhino poachers. Falling out of the sky and safely landing without a parachute. Conquering fear of death. What else do you want out of a 1 hour podcast? This lucky 12th installment of the Warrior Poet Project features my friend, the awesome extreme adventurer @donaldschultz

item.title: #11 Cory Allen
item.description: In this our third installment with one of our most requested guests, karmic wizard Cory Allen, in addition to humorous trifles we hone in on how to make sure your higher self is running the show unobstructed by the puerile and placative mind.

item.title: #10 Dr. Dan Engle
item.description: In this epic podcast with Dr. Dan Engle, a true warrior poet, Dr. Dan tells the story of his journey from college athlete to medical doctor, to holistic healer, ayahuasca shaman apprentice, and then back full circle. Recorded live at the tail end (literally!) of a liver flush and powerful spiritual vision quest, this is one of the best podcasts I have ever been a part of.

item.title: #9 AJ Hawk
item.description: In this podcast recorded on location in Green Bay with the #powerful @OfficialAJHawk we ponder how much Ayahuasca AJ would have to drink to see a flotilla of snakes, and extoll the virtues of being a spiritually enlightened meathead. We finish with some signature WPP motivational discussion, uncovering AJ's most important quality for creating a successful and happy existence.

item.title: #8 About Aubrey Marcus w/ Whitney Miller
item.description: In this very personal podcast I chat about the past, the present, and the future of my own journey in this life. Guiding forces, lessons learned, mistakes made, and an outlook for the future of both Warrior Poet and Onnit. Thanks to @WhitneyMiller10 for joining me and to all the people who reached out that inspired me to make this podcast.

item.title: #7 Cory Allen, Aubrey Marcus
item.description: In podcast 7 I bring back one of my favorite guests Cory Allen @quietdesign to once again meander the catacombs of enlightenment. We puzzle out our purpose in life and outline some strategies from our own experiences to find harmony with the universe and set oneself on a path of fulfillment.

item.title: #6 Mitch Schultz (DMT: The Spirit Molecule)
item.description: In this 6th installment of the Warrior Poet Project, I talk with Mitch Schultz, the man responsible for bringing us the outstanding documentary DMT: The Spirit Molecule. We waste no time getting into the details of the DMT experience and its cultural and interpersonal significance, drawing from personal experience and the many pioneers that Mitch has collaborated with. A fast paced and focused discussion, at one point we even have a debate on Kurzweil's ideas of the singularity, which gives me an opportunity to explain what I believe will be the true singularity. One of the best podcasts I have ever done to date, I look forward to your feedback. Please follow Mitch on Twitter @dmttsm, or on Facebook.com/the.spirit.molecule. Once again a big thank you to Cory Allen @quietdesign for helping me with the first draft of the WPP intro jam.

item.title: #4 Brian Jimerson, Aubrey Marcus
item.description: In this podcast about the paper that makes the world go round, Brian Jimerson (a successful currency trader) and I discuss the economic and social implications of a European economic meltdown that could start with Greece or Spain leaving the Euro. This leads to a discussion of precautionary measures to take with our money and preparations, from minor disruptions all the way to full Bath Salt Zombie Apocalypse! There were some audio difficulties in the original podcast, so I bring the conversation up to speed in the first half and carry on from there. Please follow Brian Jimerson (http://www.twitter.com/bignatx) for current insight into the pending crisis!

item.title: #3 Whitney Miller (Miss Texas) & Nick "The Ghost" Gonzalez
item.description: In our virgin video podcast we bring in professional fighter Nick "The Ghost" Gonzalez and Whitney Miller (Miss Texas) to discuss fighting, pageanting, and ultimately find the parallels between being 'in the zone' whatever your endeavor. The podcast closes with the game called 'The Cube', a great way to break the ice or learn something a bit deeper about someone's subconscious psychology. Please follow our gracious guests @nicktheghost and @whitneymiller10 and look for them on TV! We are still improving our technical prowess, and I mean 'we' in the King Louis royal sense of the word, so bear with me!

item.title: #2 - Cory Allen, Aubrey Marcus

We cover multiple aspects of consciousness, meditation, and psychedelic exploration. A must hear for those who enjoy the Warrior Poet philosophy.
